description: From French flâneur (“loafer, idler, dawdler, loiterer”).

entries.meaning: One who wanders aimlessly, who roams, who travels at a lounging pace.

verbs.description: flaneur (third-person singular simple present flaneurs, present participle flaneuring, simple past and past participle flaneured)

entries.meaning: To wander aimlessly or at a lounging pace. [since at least the 1860s]
examples: Meantime, we flaneured about the Guernsey market, and a remarkable pretty sight it was this bright morning.
